title: Republican casino magnate Adelson cautioned Trump on trade war with China: WSJ
text:
Casino magnate Sheldon Adelson discussed with Trump the broader implications of the US-China trade war rather than the impact on Mr Adelson's business interests, one of the people familiar with the call said, according to the newspaper report.

[WASHINGTON] A Republican donor warned President Donald Trump in a phone call last month that his escalating trade war with China could hurt his re-election prospects, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the call.

Casino magnate Sheldon Adelson discussed with Trump the broader implications of the US-China trade war rather than the impact on Mr Adelson's business interests, one of the people familiar with the call said, according to the newspaper report.

Mr Adelson, a major donor for Republican election campaigns, is the founder and chief executive officer of Las Vegas Sands Corp, a casino company that does business in the Chinese territory of Macao.

The White House did not have an immediate comment on the report. A representative of Las Vegas Sands Corp did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

sentifi.com Market voices on:

US-China trade tensions have led to tariffs on much of the commerce between the world's two biggest economies, hitting US factories and farms.

While the US economy has looked otherwise strong in recent months, a downturn might weigh on Mr Trump's hopes of winning the November 2020 election.

Washington and Beijing are in talks to restructure their trade relations, although a deal has appeared elusive. On Friday, Chinese officials unexpectedly cancelled a visit to farms in Montana and Nebraska as deputy trade negotiators wrapped up two days of negotiations in Washington.
